alert.note: Alert for North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 13 at 5:46AM PST until February 14 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Large waves and hazardous surf conditions. Breakers up to 20 to 25 feet. * WHERE...North Oregon Coast. * WHEN...From noon today to noon PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Destructive waves may wash over beaches, jetties, and other structures unexpectedly. People can be swept off rocks and jetties and drown while observing high surf. Higher than normal water run-up is expected on beaches and low-lying shoreline.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches, producing rip currents, sneaker waves and beach erosion. Stay well back from the water`s edge and be alert for exceptionally high waves. Keep away from large logs on the beach. Water running up on the beach can easily lift or roll logs which can injure or kill someone caught in their path.
